document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Helen McAdams is being referred for evaluation of persistent fatigue, unexplained weight loss, and intermittent low-grade fever of two months' duration.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports increasing fatigue over the past two months, accompanied by an unintentional weight loss of 6 kg. She has also experienced intermittent low-grade fevers (up to 38°C), occasional night sweats, and mild arthralgia. No cough, chest pain, or gastrointestinal symptoms have been noted.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: No significant past medical history. No known allergies. No previous hospitalizations or surgeries. No family history of autoimmune or malignant conditions.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Currently not taking any regular medications.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: On examination, patient appears mildly pale but is not in acute distress. Vitals: BP 116/72 mmHg, HR 84 bpm, Temp 37.8°C. No lymphadenopathy or hepatosplenomegaly. Mild pallor noted, otherwise unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations to Date
sections.content: CBC: Mild normocytic anemia (Hb 10.6 g/dL), WBC and platelets within normal limits. ESR elevated at 54 mm/hr. CRP 18 mg/L. Renal and liver function tests normal. Chest X-ray unremarkable. Basic metabolic panel normal.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistent constitutional symptoms and abnormal laboratory findings, further evaluation is warranted to rule out underlying systemic or hematological pathology. Kindly assess and advise on further diagnostic work-up and management.
